meanings.definition: The most fundamental or essential aspects or principles.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the ultrabasics of math is crucial for solving problems.
meanings.sent2: She explained the ultrabasics of cooking to the new chef.
meanings.sent3: He thought he could skip learning the ultrabasics, but soon realized he was wrong.
meanings.sent4: The ultrabasics of language are like building blocks for communication.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made sure to cover the ultrabasics before moving on to advanced topics.

meanings.definition: A substance with a pH level higher than 7.
meanings.sent1: The soap was considered an ultrabasics due to its high pH level.
meanings.sent2: The scientist tested the ultrabasics of the solution in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The ultrabasics of the shampoo made it effective for cleaning.
meanings.sent4: Her skincare routine included an ultrabasics with a pH above 7.
meanings.sent5: The ultrabasics of the pool water needed to be adjusted for safety reasons.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is extremely basic or simplistic.
meanings.sent1: He was often teased for being an ultrabasics in technology.
meanings.sent2: The design of the toy was intentionally ultrabasics for young children.
meanings.sent3: The ultrabasics of his outfit made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to problem-solving was criticized for being ultrabasics.
meanings.sent5: The ultrabasics of the game made it easy for everyone to play.
